mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-19, southwest wall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Jenny [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: What looks like a quote about belief or atheism, to which others respond. One graffiti questions suicide, to which others respond trying to convince the author of the suicide graffiti not to. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]

So it goes. | - Vonnegut - SammyAilz | C'est la vie. | Only when you believe in nothing may you embrace everything | Deez Nuts | that's ridiculous | Katy Perry? | Actually, only when you believe in something can you embrace everything. | should I off myself? | NO! your life has value!! | Don't worry you're still the best
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Religion
Life
Despair
Encouragement
Suicide
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: University of Virginia. Library. New Stacks. Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
